summary: This is an email chain from July 2019 between an FBI agent and an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York (SDNY) regarding scheduling a presentation for summer interns. The FBI agent mentions recent travel related to the Epstein case, indicating active investigation work at that time.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The SDNY prosecutor organizing a 'Law Enforcement Brown Bag' presentation for summer interns and corresponding with an FBI agent about scheduling and attire.

persons.name: FBI Agent
persons.context: An FBI agent from the New York field office who has been traveling for the Epstein case, confirming attendance at an SDNY intern presentation and asking about dress code.

connections.description: Colleagues from different agencies (SDNY and FBI) coordinating a joint presentation for summer interns, as shown in their email correspondence about scheduling and logistics.

events.title: SDNY Law Enforcement Brown Bag Presentation
events.description: A scheduled presentation for SDNY summer interns featuring law enforcement officials, including an FBI agent who had been traveling for the Epstein case.

events.title: FBI Agent Travel for Epstein Case
events.description: An FBI agent mentions in an email that they have 'been traveling a lot for that Epstein case,' indicating active investigation work shortly before Epstein's arrest.

keyFacts: The email chain is dated July 2019, just weeks before Jeffrey Epstein's arrest on July 6, 2019.
An FBI agent explicitly states they have 'been traveling a lot for that Epstein case,' confirming active investigative work by the FBI prior to Epstein's arrest.
The correspondence shows coordination between the SDNY U.S. Attorney's Office and the FBI regarding community outreach (intern presentations), indicating professional collaboration.
The tone is informal and collegial, suggesting routine inter-agency cooperation amidst a major ongoing investigation.
